imho Team Fortress Classic > Fortress Forever > Team Fortress 2, because of game physics, mechanics, relatively small download size, and other reasons...

You can compare [url=http://steamcharts.com/cmp/20,253530#1m]the data[/url] for Team Fortress Classic (TFC) vs.  Fortress Forever, and as of now, TFC has more players online than Fortress Forever. Ask why people would prefer playing TFC for $5 vs. Fortress Forever(free to download)?
This game took over my life once upon a time...

What a great game, a classic, a free add-on for Half-Life 1 online play, released back in 1999. Unfortunately the only two active servers left are horrible.
One is Drippy's 2fort, and for sad reasons, they only play the map 2fort 24/7, with these super annoying sounds, weird technocrap, general random strange crap happening. 2fort used to be one of the best maps, but TFC made so many more maps, and these guys just rather stick with 2fort only in the worst possible ways. Players usually 3-8 during low peak and 5-20 during high peak.
Then there is EVIL-Battlezone X. They do go through some maps but their tendency is also to stick mostly with 2fort. Here the admins are mostly not really smart people, they love to ban and kick the few players left that play this game, for the smallest little things (building SG too close to spawn, etc). Less populated than Drippy's, usually around 4-10 players during peak hours.
There is alternatively also a BOT server, it can have 3-24 players against bots. The most fun for sure but it is ultimately in most maps just a spam party. People pick Demomen and just spam grenades into bots, and that's that. Why many of these same guys do it for the past few years on a daily basis for several hours a day goes beyond all my knowledge but I guess they must be somewhere there in the spectrum.
I would have recommended this game from 1999 - 2012, after that all we got are 2 - 3 boring servers. 
GG TFC, it was has been mad fun !
EXTREMELY DIFFERENT FROM TF2, but its still a fun Experience, i enjoyed it. Its worth a Go if you want to see what its like.

Моё знакомство с этой игрой было недолгим, но этого времени хватило для окончательного вывода: есть современные аналоги онлайн шутеров, переключите своё внимание на них, а данный экземпляр оставьте для преданных фанатов. Семь режимов игры, десять классов, девять из которых доступны в большинстве режимов игры. Игра за каждый класс существенно различается, для успешной игры нужно знать тактику и стратегию игры за каждый класс. Разные классы должны уметь взаимодействовать между собой. Очень жаль что я не познакомился с игрой во времена её популярности, возможно я нашёл бы несколько причин, по которым ещё стоит в неё играть.

Team Fortress Classic (También conocido como TFC) es un FPS (First Person Shooter) en donde nueve clases distintas, 
luchan por la victoria.

Team Fortress Classic es un mod (Modificación) del videojuego Half-Life (HL), utilizando el mismo motor gráfico de dicho 
videojuego, y ciertas mecánicas tomadas de Half-Life.

Team Fortress Classic incorporá nueve clases, cada una de ellas, incorporán armas distintas (A excepción de ciertas 
armas), distintas habilidades, distintos "Playstyle" (Estilos de Juego) que más se adapte al jugador, entre otras cosa más.

Las clases que se encuentran en el Team Fortress Classic son las siguientes:
1) El Scout: 
     Es la clase más rápida de todas las clases disponibles. El Scout, no solo posee gran velocidad, sino, también tiene la 
     posibilidad de esquivar grandes cantidades de daño de ciertos enemigos, gracias a su increible velocidad. A parte de 
     poseer gran velocidad y esquiva, el Scout posee una escasa cantidad de salud, haciéndolo sumamente vulnerable a 
     ciertos tipos de daño, tanto a cohetes como a balas.

2) El Soldier: 
     El Soldier es una de las clases con más puntos de salud que se encuentran entre todas las clases disponibles. Esta 
     clase posee un lanzacohetes, una escopeta y una palanca, aunque, su velocidad de movimiento esta entre 
     lenta / intermedia.

3) El Pyro: 
     El Pyro es un pirómano que posee un lanzallamas, una escopeta, una palanca y un lanzacohetes que prende en 
     llamas a los enemigos. El Pyro suele emplear su lanzallamas junto a enemigos con grandes cantidades de salud, 
     mientras que el lanzacohetes, es para un área repleta de enemigos. Al quemar a un enemigo con el lanzallamas, 
     este arderá en llamas durante varios segundos, restándole dos (O más) puntos de salud por segundo, al igual 
     que sucede con el lanzacohetes, solamente, que el impacto de la explosión del lanzacohetes hace un daño en 
     especifíco, y la combustión viene después, haciéndo la msima cantidad de daño y por segundo.

4) El Demoman: 
      El Demoman es un experto en demoliciones, que posee un lanzagranadas, un lanzabombas lapa, una escopeta, 
      y una palanca. El Demoman utiliza su lanzagranadas para un área repleta de enemigos, o un enemigo en común.
      El Lanzabombas Lapa se utiliza para pegar bombas lapa en ciertas áreas y zonas, hasta que un enemigo se acerque 
      al área repleta de bombas lapa, y el Demoman las haga explotar cuando el quiera, produciéndo una cantidad 
      exagerada de daño, llegando a matar al enemigo.

5) El Heavy: 
     El Heavy es la clase con más puntos de salud entre todas las clases disponibles. El Heavy posee una poderosa 
     metralladora automática con una gran tasa de disparo, una escopeta y una palanca. A comparación con el resto 
     de las clases, el Heavy es la clase más lenta del videojuego, pero el daño que hace es destructivo.

6) El Engineer: 
     El Engineer es una de las clases más fundamentales en un equipo. El Engineer es un ingeniero que posee un 
     menu de construcción, en el que, puede elegir que construir, un Arma Centinela (También conocida como Torreta), 
     un Dispensador y un Teletransportador. Un Engineer le aporta mucho a su equipo al tener este tipo de 
     construcciones puestas y construídas tal como estan, pero estas construcciones pueden ser destruídas por los 
     enemigos. Al construir una construcción cualquiera, el Engineer gasta una cantidad especifíca de metal de 
     construcción.

7) El Medic: 
     El Medic es la clase curativa de todos las clases disponibles. El Medic posee un dispositivo curativo para curar a sus 
     aliados de equipo, y para envenenar permanentemente a sus enemigos, a menos de que el enemigo muera de 
     cualquier forma, o simplemente, envenenado, aunque esto se puede evadir, siendo curado por otro Medic aliado. 
     A parte de poseer un dispositivo curativo, el Medic posee una pistola de jeringas, una escopeta y una palanca, 
     haciéndolo una clase con variedad de armas para prolongar su duración en el combate, y seguir curando a sus 
     aliados de equipo, conllevándolos a la victoria. Como habilidad pásiva, el Medic regenera +2 puntos de salud por 
     segundo si es que ha sido hérido por cualquier tipo de daño.

8) Sniper: 
     El Sniper es parte de las clases más débiles del juego, pero con paciencia, esta clase puede llegar a aniquilar hasta a 
     un Heavy de un solo disparo a la cabeza. El Sniper posee un rifle de francotirador, una metralleta automática 
     (Es como un tipo de SMG), una escopeta y una palanca. El Sniper puede matar a cualquier clase con un disparo 
     cargado a la cabeza de un solo tiro (Headshot cargado), pero esto requerirá de un poco de paciencia, para así, 
     cazar a la víctima con éxito.

9) Spy: 
     El Spy es parte de las clases más débiles del juego. Tal como dice su nombre, el Spy es un espía, que se dedica a 
     engañar a los enemigos, disfrazándose de ellos, al igual que fingir una muerte para que nadie sospeche de nada.
     El Spy posee una pistola que dispara dardos que tranquilizan al enemigo, reduciéndo su velocidad de movimiento 
     y provocando alucinaciones por un corto plazo, un cuchillo para matar a un enemigo al instante, 
     un menu de disfraces para disfrazarse del enemigo que se desea ser, entre otras cosas más.

Team Fortress Classic es un videojuego excelente por si disfrutas de los videojuegos clásicos online, y con una 
comunidad un poco activa, que suele crear mapas, armas, etc, para el videojuego, que no suelen consumir 
tanto espacio (Depende, pero la mayoría, no consume tanto espacio).

Mi calificación para este videojuego es de: 9.0 / 10

Is this game bad? No. This game is obviously a good little shooter that was once THE king of online gaming before the mod known as Counter-Strike came along and it was replaced by the admittedly better Team Fortress 2. But why did I not recommend it? Because fifteen years ago this game was FULL of players well into the 2000s. Now only a special few still play the game. It's a shame because its actually quite a nice little gem to have in your inventory and show off to your friends.

Pros:
- A good selection of weapons that you wouldn't find in Team Fortress 2 (Pyro has a fire nuke!)
- Pure nostalgia entering servers that are 10 years old and still have Scatman music playing in the background.
- One shot snipers.
- Much harder to play and understand. Very rewarding.

Cons:
- Unfortunately those same weapons I mentioned before do barely any damage. (Pyros Flamethrower does 3dmg!)
- Serious balance issues (Pyro is the worst class in the game)
- GRENADES. THEY SHOULDN'T EXIST IN A GAME LIKE THIS.
- Hardly anyone plays anymore.

Overall you should spend that five bucks if you truly want to see what this game is about. Otherwise I would be recommending Team Fortress 2 or any of the other First Person Shooters.

Also to any Aussie players, there is one local server but it has a password on it. Thus you may need to use the US servers.

Great game, but PLEASE DO NOT compare it to TF2. When I first played it, that's what I did, and I hated it. I recently started it up again with the mindset of "an old shooter, not like TF2" and I loved it.

Please buy it, as the playerbase has gotten low in recent years, and I'd hate to see this game die. I didn't get a chance to play it when it was popular. I'd kill to see TFC in it's prime.

In conclusion, if you like TF2, you'll probably hate it, but if you don't compare it to TF2, it's loads of fun.

Team Fortress Classic is a FPS developed and released by Valve Corporation in 1999. It is the sequel to the popular Quake mod, Team Fortress, now remade with the Half-Life engine. And it is the prequel to our favorite Party Simulator, Team Fortress 2. Matches in Team Fortress Classic pit two teams against each other, with each team member having access to nine distinct classes. Competition takes place in a variety of scenarios, usually capture the flag, VIP protection, or territorial control. Since its release, the game has undergone significant upgrades to player models and game modes.
I'll just say it right now guys, this game is GREAT. The classes, the graphics (Aged rather well, considering it was 99), the fast action and variety of weapons etc. I think it's actually near perfect.....Gameplay-wise.
What really brings the game down to me is the fact that now it's almost empty. If you want proof, open up Counter Strike 1.6 and take a look at the servers. Then, open up TFC and take a look at the servers. Sad, sad indeed. And the only servers with actual people are full of people that are probably going to kick your ass big time, no mercy will be shown, so you have 3 choices: Get good, get good or GIT GUD, these guys can't even be considered simple veterans, these guys probably know the game better than the creators themselves. The game is really different from TF2 so don't think it's all going to be sunshine and rainbows, the gameplay is faster, no hats, no other weapons and the game doesn't get all the updates and attention TF2 receives every day. You know what this means? Almost no people in the servers and unbalanced gameplay at some points because of no patches (Grenades, Bhopping and MEDIC, GODDAMN IT MEDIC). However, if you want to play a solid FPS, that, in my personal opinion, would be way better than Counter Strike 1.6 (Yes, I f.u.c.king said that.) if it only had more people. PLAY THIS, it's an absolute must for any FPS fan and an overlooked, underrated gem nowadays.

Team Fortress Classic прародительница Team Fortress 2 именно она послужила созданию 2 части, 1 часть игры была на движке Gold Source запускалась на 3 программы такие как DirectX. OpenGL, Software, в самом начале только на software, у скаута не было обреза но было ппм которое сейчас у снайпера во 2 части, отличия от 1 и 2 части ещё в том что Team Fortress 2 на движке Source что делает её более реалистичной, у солдата был ракетомёт и дробовик, у пиро был огнемёт( не было сжатого воздуха) дробовик, ппм и ракетомёт стреляющик ракетами которые поджигают врага заменение тому ракетница в тим фортрессе 2 у подрывника было 2 гранатомёта 1 стреляющий бомбами которые как и 2 части игры взрываются через определённое время и гранатомёт который стреляет как липучкомёт но не приклеивается к стенам хотя на NTFC серверах это такой аддон при наличии определённого числа убившихся тобой людей можно выбрать sticky bombs что даёт бомбы липучки в общем игра крута хорошей игры, фрагов и побед!

TFC - прародитель TF2, которая вышла в далеком 1999 году. 
Классический мультиплеерный FPS: 2 противоборствующие стороны, 10 классов, 7 оф. режимов игры и 4 неофициальных.

К сожалению, на сегодняшний день сервера практически пусты и комфортно поиграть можно только с друзьями. Эх, где же вы старые добрые времена, когда в TFC играла куча народа..

Говорить о графике смысла нет, ибо возраст игры дает о себе знать. Однако геймплей не растерял своей динамичности и разнообразия. 

Я, однозначно, рекомендую поиграть в TFC не только фанам TF2, но и всем остальным геймерам, т.к классику нужно знать в лицо!

[b] *Здесь могла бы быть классическая шутка про отсутствие шапок =)* [/b]
Builds excellently upon the original Quake Team Fortress in the glorious GoldSrc engine. What's not to love?
No hats dont buy it.

The first team based FPS classic still runs! Bought this for pure nostalgia, find myself playing it often.
No levels, or upgrades, or any of that stuff. Choose Red or Blue, Pick your class, and Fight!
Love this game!
The interface is confusing and gameplay is clunky. I can't even figure out how to build a sentry. But the Half-Life-style gameplay in Gold Source is fun to move around in.

El Mejor Juego De La Historia. 
Best Game Ever :)

I have played this game for only 20 minutes, and I already know that it has none (or barely, BARELY any) of the community, size, responsiveness, or gameplay quality of TF2. 

Servers are mostly barren, and the ones that are up just have matches that don't really go anywhere.

Especially by today's standards, this game feels less like a full game and more like some iffy early access clone of TF2.

If you end up getting this game through the valve complete pack, then you won't be wasting your time if you just pop it in for a second as a quick little curio and see how much better TF2 is than this...........But if you get this instead of just downloading TF2 (for free), then you're................pretty much out of touch with gaming as a whole right now.

For gaming history purposes, I guess it's nice to have this on steam, but it really just doesn't compare to TF2 in any way, shape or form. It just doesn't hold up at all by today's standards.

4.4/10

What can I say? My favorite game of all time. Became something the developers didn't see coming. Teamwork is a must in 'serious' games. Huge learning curve and always many skills to master, yet fun and easy to play around. TF2 is subpar due to lack of concing and other things that makes this game unique. Despite its age, it's still fun to pub in the handful of servers left, and there are a few serious gamers lingering that can bring it back like in the old days.
Best game 10/10 tf2 is terrible compared to this piece of art, I reccomend playing as spy, you'll feel as if everything you know in tf2 is a lie.

In the late 90's this game was my first experience with a online multiplayer game, that involved more than myself and one other person.  ( We used to direct dial Doom, Doom 2, and Heretic ).  I played the hell out of this game.  My first online FPS fragfest.   I'm glad the game still exists, and from my experience my memories of this game still outshine Team Fortress 2.  Cheers to Team Fortress in all it's dial up glory. :)
"Classic" ...that says it all ;)

A great underrated classic that still has populated servers 24/7. (You can check for players with the in-game server list, bots won't be shown.) TFC offers one-of-a-kind exciting fast paced gameplay with tons of tactics and ways of playing the game. Easy to get into and enjoy, hard to master. However, you're bound to have fun along the way.

Despite old age, the game has a timeless design with a completely customizable appearance; you can choose from many custom models, sprites, skins, textures etc. There are active community servers hosting many of thousands of custom maps total with official game modes like; Capture The Flag, Control point, Attack/Defend, Escort, Deathmatch as well as custom ones like King of the Hill, Hold or Score Ball etc.

If you're interested in skill jumping (with weapons) there are servers hosting maps made for conc-, grenade-, rocket- and pipe jumping. There are also a lot of movement skill maps where you can climb, bunnyhop, strafe, surf, ramp slide and even water glide (shark) on a few servers. Or if you just want to play some random fun maps and mess around, there's escape, puzzle, hide & seek, sniping, role-play, secret hunting, low gravity and so on. As for mods, there's NeoTF (which gives you extra abilities and buildables), AdminOP (Ent Mod, Radio Mod, Hook Mod) and others.

It's not just one of, but [i]The[/i] most popular online multiplayer game of all back in 1999 before CS took the crown. Nowadays, there are barely any FPS games that don't get boring after a few hours. TFC will have you keep coming back for more, time and time again. Without relying on achievements or item drops.
